The buyer grabs the seller's shirt and tries to get cash back.  A fight ensues. McCROSKY He didn't have a crew either.  He said he couldn't do it.  But when the going got tough that kid pulled it together.
The seller's shirt is ripped.  Knives are pulled. McCROSKY You might have read about him; he made all the big papers and the Canadian Jewish News.
The seller is stabbed. McCROSKY I don't know where he is today but if he was up there right now, I know he'd find some way to turn that bucket around and get the hell out of there, pronto!
I wish I could talk like that -- so macho yet so sensitive.
ANGLE ON McCROSKY'S BOOK - "PEP TALKS FOR ALL OCCASIONS" McCrosky slams it shut. McCROSKY I just hope I said the right thing.

I'm afraid you gave the wrong speech. McCrosky.  I'm not your problem.  It's this ship.  That computer's gone bananas. McCROSKY (holding up the book) Why the hell are we still using the old manual!  Burn this book!
A smiling blonde man in a white sweater with "MORAL MAJORITY" on the front walks by and takes the book. McCROSKY (on radio) Just hold on, Striker, we'll get back to you.

Ted writes a note to Elaine and hands it to her -- it rea "WE MUST FIND SOME WAY TO BLOW THAT COMPUTER!"  Elaine lo a bit nervous and licks her lip.  They look up at ROK's pulsating eye. Testa pokes her head in.  She's soaked with sweat.
The cabin temperature is rising.  The passengers want to know what's happening up here.
Let us handle this end of things.  Now what's the coffee situation?
It just won't drip!  I've tried everything.  And the passengers are dropping like flies from the heat.
Passengers reel and drop to floor.
Elaine, I'm going back there.  Just hold onto that stick and try to control this hunk of tin as best you can.
Ted, please be careful.
Ted leaves.  We hear an enormous CRASH on the other side the door.
JOE DIMAGGIO (MR. COFFEE), drinking a cup of coffee, rush in accompanied by a GROUND CONTROL OFFICER.
(to Joe) It doesn't look good.  The drip seems to be jammed up pretty bad.
Did they change the filter and wait for the brew sign to light up?
(stopping and looking Mr. Coffee in the eye) To tell you the truth, sir, I don't really know.
One holds a hat, one pulls a slip of paper from it.
(reading his slip) Eighty-three.  What's that mean?
If eighty-three passengers die, you win the two hundred bucks.
They approach McCrosky.
Mr. McCrosky, Mr. Coffee.  Coffee, McCrosky. McCROSKY Thanks for coming down so soon.
(checking watch) I won't come down for another couple hours. McCROSKY I'll put you on the radio with Striker. Jeez you look familiar.  Did you ever play water polo?
Not to my knowledge. McCROSKY I thought so.
It roars towards the sun.  The nose of the ship begins to glow red.
"MERCURY SHUTTLE HEADS FOR DISASTER"

head_text.subj: "THEY SHOULDN'T HAVE GONE IN THE FIRST PLACE"

text: Set logo reads, "NEWS 4 BUFFALO."
Four alarm fire rages through downtown Buffalo!
Mercury shuttle heads for sun.
Set logo reads, "NEWS 4 TOKYO"
(subtitles) Four alarm fire guts Tokyo apartment.
(subtitles) Mercury mission in death struggle.
Set logo reads, "NEWS 3 MOSCOW."  A gun is held to ANCHORMAN'S head.
(subtitles) Four alarm fire in downtown Moscow clears way for glorious new tractor factory.
(subtitles) Capitalist, imperialist adventurism ends in space disaster.
If this country was run by vegetarian women who's old men deserted them after knocking them up instead of by meat-eating males, this thing never would have happened.
A banner hangs over terminal door:  "HOUSTON WELCOMES SPA

CLOSEUP OF ATTACHE CASE being carried to the door -- stic on it reads, "NATIONAL ENQUIRER." CLOSEUP OF ANOTHER CASE coming from other direction -- sticker on it reads, "NATIONAL STAR." The cases meet.  LOOSEN to REPORTERS.
(to STAR) I never forget a face.  'Texas doctor claims sex with chicken cures baldness?'
'Severed legs grow back after Utah man finds Christ?'
Long time no see.
They shake hands and turn into the terminal.
Controllers stand over Mr. Coffee -- everyone sips coffee and smokes cigarettes.
(on radio) Have you got the back panel off the brew manifold?
Ted has the coffee machine apart, wears a headset and hol wires in pliars.  Anxious passengers with coffee cups sta over him -- they are all totally wired and going cold turkey.
(into headset) Check.
There's a terminal at the base of the coil.  That's your contact point.
A PASSENGER bends down and picks a coffee bean off the floor.
Is this a coffee bean?
(maniacally) He's got a bean!!
A riot ensues.  The "bean" Passenger is beaten to death.
(into headset) It looks like the solder point has melted.
(enraged) Just what I thought.  When the hell will you people realize that adding extra water after the initial brew cycle overheats the system!!  Now listen to me, Striker, and listen good.
It careens towards the sun.
Detective Hallick storms in and up to McCrosky.  He flash his badge.
Who's in charge here, Mister? McCROSKY McCrosky, Control.
Hallick, homicide.
Jacobs, Pisces.
Kruger, Sagittarius.
Commissioner, Aquarius.
We have information that one of your passengers is carrying a bomb and might be suicidal. McCROSKY Where'd you get this information, Captain?
We have our methods.
And what methods are those?
Have you heard of the Heimlich method? McCROSKY The method of saving someone choking on a piece of gristle?
Exactly. KRUGER/McCROSKY/COMMISSIONER We're familiar with it.
Good.  This is the passenger's wife.  Mrs. Joe Salucci.
She approaches very distressed looking. McCROSKY What makes you think your husband might want to blow up that shuttle, ma'am?
She goes into her purse for the insurance form.
This insurance policy.
A large ivory colored vibrator drops out of her purse, hi the floor, and flips on.  They all look at it.
An electric tooth. (handing McCrosky the insurance form) Joey was supposed to go to Des Moines for an operation to cure his impotence. McCROSKY The Des Moines Institute?
Then you know it. KRUGER/McCROSKY/COMMISSIONER Yes, we're familiar with it.
Well, I found out Joey got on this shuttle instead and...
The way I read it, blowin' up a plane in space leaves no traces, if you know what I mean.
I'm not exactly sure what you mean, Captain.
No blood.  No body.  No bones.  No eyes. No ears.  No throats. McCROSKY (looking at form) This is $500,000 worth of insurance!
Kruger, Commissioner, and Hallick all whistle "wow!" McCROSKY Just a second.  This is insurance on his car!
That's what worries me.
He's impotent.
He's suicidal.
And he's stupid!
(into radio) This is it, Striker.  You got one shot and one shot only.
Striker stands over the coffee machine, sweating like mad The Passengers with cups hang over him. He makes contact with a wire.
(to self) Contact.
The MACHINE EXPLODES.  Coffee gushes out like an oil well coming in.  The Passengers dance under the gusher of brow liquid, mouths open and cheering.
McCROSKY How are we going to handle this bomb nut?
(rushes up with printouts) Here are the tests we ran on their computer.  I had them xeroxed for you. McCROSKY How'd they come out?

Upside-down, but I turned each page over and put them in order.  I'm afraid that computer is totally capable of taking control of that ship. McCROSKY Let's keep cool.  There's gotta be a way to control it.
He lights a cigarette.
(rushes up with diagrams) These are their position calculations. They've got about ten minutes before they start to burn up. McCROSKY Keep calm.  A lot can happen in ten minutes. (to self) What next?
He sips his coffee.
(rushes in) Sir, your headlights are on and your doors are locked! McCROSKY (spitting out coffee, Danny Thomas style) Jesus!!  I'll be right back!
McCrosky races out.
It heads closer to the sun.  The nose is glowing.
Elaine is checking computer.  The cockpit is steaming now She unbuttons her uniform just as Ted comes in.
Ted, we've only got ten minutes.
(thinking she wants sex) Not now, Elaine.
I mean until we start to burn up.
Ted takes his seat and looks at a panel gauge.
We're closer to the sun than I estimated.
One is labeled "EXACT DISTANCE" and reads, "76.50".  The other is labeled "ESTIMATED DISTANCE" and reads, "5689465932.09".
Come in, Mayflower.  This is Bud Kruger. Over.
(on radio) This is Striker.
(on radio) Look, Striker, I don't know how you got into that driver's seat but I want Simon Kurtz on that radio and I want him now!

(on radio) Kurtz was the one who got us into this mess in the first place.  You people knew this ship wasn't ready to fly.  You played God with over a hundred lives, Kruger, and for what -- the prestige of your precious space program.
That was very well put, Ted.
Jacobs stands next to Kruger rubbing his forefingers together in the "shame, shame" sign.
(on radio) Striker, you're heading right for the sun, so don't you think it's a little late for that bleeding heart liberal crap now?
He's got a point, Ted.
There are columns under Kruger's and Striker's names. Striker has two check marks.  Jacobs gives Kruger one.
(on radio) Call me a bleeding heart, but if we get through this thing I'm preparing a paper on alternative spending directives recommending the transfer of space program funds to low cost housing.
(on radio) Just put Kurtz on that radio!!

McCrosky rushes in and grabs the mike from Kruger. McCROSKY (enraged) Look, Kruger, you and your people have caused enough trouble already.  I don't care about your political games, I care about only one thing, the lives of those people up there!!!  Out of my control room!!

Someone's car wouldn't start. McCROSKY (on mike) Striker, this is McCrosky.  Give me five minutes and keep your fingers crossed. (to Stinson) Stinson, get me the Mayflower plans! (to Controller 3) You, clear this table!
I'll get the cards and bridge mix. McCROSKY And someone get me the Sarg!
leaning over the ship's plans.  He is eating another ciga All Controllers stand around him.

That's my little girl, my little darlin', my sweetheart, my honey, and you want to blow her belly out with that bomb.  If you blast here in the computer core and the fuselage doesn't give way here and the main communication lines to the cockpit hold here and this baby here doesn't jam this little old unit up here and throw about two tons of hot steel through here like a hot knife through butter and the upper and lower... McCROSKY What's your point, Sarg?
I have no point. McCROSKY Then it's settled.  The bomb is Striker's only chance.  Are there any questions?
No sir. McCROSKY Those are answers, I asked for questions.
Should a man in his forties have a circumcision? McCROSKY Absolutely.
Well, Elaine, this might be it if those guys on the ground don't think of something.
I just want you to know, I love you Ted and always will.
That might be the news we've been waiting for.
He grabs radio. McCROSKY (V.O.) I've got some news for you, Striker.
Ted and Elaine smile hopefully at each other.
(on radio) Roger. McCROSKY (V.O.) One of your passengers is carrying a bomb and is suicidal.
A b...
She covers her mouth. McCROSKY (V.O.) No, a bomb.
Joe Salucci wipes his brow, lays his case on his lap.
Ted and Mary huddle.
Which passenger is Joe Salucci?
Sixteen 'C', why?
He's carrying a bomb.
A b...
She covers her mouth.
No, a bomb.  Now, as discreetly as possible, I want you to move the passengers into the lounge.
What should I say?
Anything.  Just don't let Salucci think we're onto him.
Ted moves down the aisle.  Mary gets on the P.A.
Would everyone not carrying a bomb please move to the lounge.
The Passengers go nuts screaming, "A bomb!!"
(jumping up with his case) Don't anyone move!
All the passengers pile up in a ceiling-to-floor wall beh Ted -- he extends his arms, holding them back.
Mr. Salucci, listen to me.
Ted takes a step forward away from the wall of passengers the wall crumbles.
Joe, you don't want to blow that thing and kill all these innocent people.
I don't want to live anymore.
Joe, the insurance policy won't help your wife and kids.  You bought auto insurance, not life insurance.
What?
(inching up on him) That's right, Joe.  Now, no one's going to hurt you and no one has to know what's wrong with you.
You're sure?
I'm sure.
Ted is almost up to Joe when:
(yells) That's the guy from the terminal who can't get it up!!

Joe bolts.  Passengers panic.  Ted tackles him.  The case flies into the air in SLOW MOTION.  It turns slowly, hang for the longest time as we CUT, still in SLOW MOTION, to horrified faces watching it.  This SLOW MOTION sequence lasts for about 60 seconds -- people put on make-up, do macrame, read, etc. -- while the case is still in the air Suddenly, Scraps leaps high into the air in SLOW MOTION a comes down with the case between his teeth.
Controllers huddle over one monitor. McCROSKY Get that bomb, Striker!  Get that bomb!
Come in, Control!  We have the bomb!!
He's got the bomb!!
This is just like an election in Iran.
Ted is back at the controls -- the cockpit is incredibly now.
This heat's getting unbearable.
He looks down and sees two eggs frying on the dash.
But it is a dry heat, Ted.
Controllers are grouped around the plans. McCROSKY Do we use the bomb to blow that computer or is there another way?  I want to know what everyone thinks.
I think... (changes mind) ... No.
We could knock out the wall between the cockpit and cabin, and hang plants.
I think... (changes mind) ... No.
You can't knock that wall out.  That's a support wall, asshole.
I think... (changes mind) No.
Did I flush? McCROSKY Then it's settled.  We use the bomb. (grabs radio) Striker, McCrosky.
McCROSKY (V.O.) We've gone over the blueprints and you've got only one option.
(on radio) I know what you're going to say, McCrosky -- knock out the wall between the cockpit and cabin and hang plants. McCROSKY (V.O.) Forget it.  That's a support wall.  Use the bomb.
The b...
She covers her mouth. McCROSKY (V.O.) I keep telling you, not the b...  The bomb!!
(almost to self) Why, you'd have to be crazy to try a stunt like that.
Elaine looks at Ted.
All passengers look forward in Ted's direction.
SUPER the womb over Ted's face.
You're too low in the womb, Striker! You've got to come out feet first!
(grabs case) Elaine.  I'm going back there.
Ted... I love you.  Be careful.
Ted leaves.
McCROSKY (to his controllers) I want everyone on their toes for this one.
Handing out ballet slippers to the Controllers who are passing a joint down the line. McCROSKY And if anyone has any ideas, I want to hear them now.
How about a show just like Hollywood Squares but with kids.  Gary Coleman could host.
The Passengers stand in the aisle listening to Mary.
Now I want everyone to move to the front of the cabin.
Passengers move calmly.
That's fine.  Stay calm.  We just want everyone as far away from the blast as possible.
The Passengers panic and stampede right over her.
Ted wears a gas mask and attaches the time-bomb to the computer.
What are you doing, Ted?  Why are you wearing that mask, Ted?
Gas spews out of a vent.  Ted makes sure his gas mask is tight.
Simon is dressed in space suit and moving down the aisle. Elaine holds onto him.
Simon!  Wait!  What are you doing?!
They pass Father O'Flanagan.  He has a Bongo drum at his seat.
Under the 'B', sixteen!
I've lost the ship and now I've lost you, Elaine.  I'm getting out.
Simon, I didn't want it to end like this. We can be friends!  You'll die out there.
Maybe.
Simon, what are you saying?!
Simon steps into a hatch labeld, "ESCAPE CAPSULE".
I'm saying, I can't take the singles scene again, Elaine.
The hatch door slams shut.  A passenger passes with a sandwich board that reads, "JESUS WAS A SINGLE."
Simon, no!
Jimmy appears and yells through the window on the hatch.
You want to talk about it now, Commander?
The capsule ejects.
The Commissioner stands in front of the painting of astronauts on black velvet.  He is on the phone.
Give me the President of the United States.  Tell him it's the Commissioner. (to Kruger) I don't know how the old man's going to take this.

The PRESIDENT poses for a photo session:  CLOSEUP of President holding aloft in a victory salute, the hands of two black men.  On the camera flash we LOOSEN to reveal t bodiless arms of two black mannequins.  An AID hands the phone to the President.
Houston, sir.
(taking phone) This is the President... What?!... What?!
He walks past a wall of photos of past presidents:  JFK, Johnson, Nixon, Ford, Carter, Reagan, Reagan older, Reaga much older, Merv Griffin, a chimp, and this President.
I don't think that shuttle's going to make it, sir.
The President passes an Arab piling millions in cash onto his desk.
Damnit, Mister, the dignity and integrity of this presidency depends on the success of that mission.  And that's my last word!
Yes, sir.
They both hang up and, making sure no one is watching, pi their noses.

head_text.subj: WIPE TO FULL SCREEN OF OVAL OFFICE

text: What's our strategy on this one, sir?

I work for the people of these United States, Frank.  I have to do what's best for them. (grabs the red phone) Al, kill social security, cancel school lunches only for the poor, dismantle welfare, close all hospitals and public toilets, green light the MX-6, invade Brazil, and bring my horse around after my nap!
Ted is at the controls.  Elaine rushes in.
Simon just ejected!
Sit down, Elaine.  If this bomb trick works we just might make it.  Simon was a fool to eject now.
You mean...
That's right -- premature ejection.
What will happen to him, Ted?
The sun will heat that thing to over 450 degrees within seconds.  He'll roast like a pig on a spit.
We see a roast on a spit through the window.
The clock on the time bomb TICKS down.
(looking at wristwatch) Are you afraid?
Not when I'm with you, Ted.
I guess you'd have to be a fool not to be afraid at a time like this.
Mrs. Gooch sucks on her cushion -- she's totally zonked o acid.
Are you afraid?
(looking at her hands) Are these my hands?
(to Stella) Are you afraid?
I'm a nurse.  I can't afford to be afraid, Father.
(to Scraps) Are you afraid, Scraps?
(he BARKS once, subtitle translate) Now when there's a guy like Ted Striker up there, Jimmy. (he BARKS one more time -- subtitles) Now how about a little scratch on the inner thigh?
Testa stands over Ted with a clipboard.
Fifty-six percent of the passengers are afraid.  Twenty-nine percent are not afraid.  Eight percent are undecided and seven percent think Israel should give back Finland.
You better strap yourself in, Testa. (on radio) Mission control, this is Mayflower.  Over. McCROSKY (V.O.) Go ahead, Striker.
(on radio) We've got about 60 seconds before that thing blows.  We're set to reprogram for Mercury at zero point five WORP.
McCROKSY (on radio) Zero point five WORP?!

That's right.  When the bomb explodes we're going to have a ten foot hole in the fuselage and I want to get there as fast as I can.  I know what this snip can do, McCrosky. McCROKSY (to Controllers) No one's ever travelled at that speed before.
Last spring we did Europe in nine days.
It careens towards the sun.
Bomb clock TICKS down.
Mary instructs Passengers.
Heads between the knees! (looking down aisle) Between your own knees, Father!
O'Flanagan looks around guiltily.

McCrosky addresses his troops. McCROSKY I don't find it easy to talk at a time like this, but I want to say something about that guy up there.  I can sum it all up in one word -- courage, dedication, spirit, pride, selflessness, and g-u-t-s, guts.  Striker's got more guts in his little finger than most of us have in our large intestine.  He's got guts up to his eyeballs, guts coming out of his ears.

Controllers start playing cards, doing needlepoint. McCROSKY Sure it's a cliche but great shortstops are born, not made, and a clown is funny in the circus but when he gets on the highway, he's murder.  It bugged me too when Mr. Ed refused to talk when the neighbors came over but...
The bomb TICKS down and BLOWS.
The ship shakes violently.  Ted fights for control.
The ship starts bumping as if it's hit a rough road.
(on radio) We've blown the computer! (to Elaine) Elaine!  Set course change!
(flips a switch) Set!
Now!
(pushes a button) Compute!
"Compute" sign flashes. Ted pulls an acceleration lever.
Here goes.
It slows to a halt.
Ted pulls the lever hard toward himself.  The ship shudde
The ship slingshots in the opposite direction, disappeari into the void leaving a trail of light.
(on radio) Point five WORP!
PAN Controllers looking intently into the night sky.  PAN Mrs. Salucci intently gripping her vibrator -- it's on. to Jacobs reading VARIETY -- headline: "PARAMOUNT ANNOUNC
McCROSKY Zero point five WORP, that's half the speed of light.  We really have no idea what can happen to the human body at that speed.
Two Passengers (contortionists) with legs up over their shoulders and looking out over their rear ends, play card

The interior vibrates.  A psychedelic blaze of multi-colo light illuminates the interior.  Ted struggles with the controls. McCROSKY (V.O.) Striker, we're monitoring you.  You're right on course.  At that speed you should hit Mercury in about six minutes.  So give yourself enough time to kill those WORP engines.

McCROSKY (on radio) We'll be out of radio range in a few seconds.  I'm going to put you in contact with Mercury Base Alpha Beta for your final descent.  Over. (off mike) Stinson, who's in command of Alpha Beta?
Al Hammil?
Not anymore.  It's Rex Kramer, now. McCROSKY Not Rex Kramer!
No, Rex Kramer.
We see the Alpha Beta base in distance with an ALPHA BETA neon sign flashing. SFX:  WAILING SUBMARINE SIREN.
Four uniformed officers race to their posts around a corn and collide with four others racing around the corner fro the other direction.
REX KRAMER watches the floors flash by on the panel above the door.
O.S. we hear a DOG GROWLING and fighting with something.
I know this guy, Ted Striker.  I flew with him during the war.  He was a crack pilot but he didn't have it in the crunch... That is...
Until that day over Chicago.  He brought that busted up 767 out of that storm like a paper glider coming outta the baby blue.
But flying that shuttle is a whole different ballgame.

The elevator doors open.  Kramer steps out into the communications room. SFX:  SUBMARINE SIREN WAILS. PAN down to floor of elevator to find a young officer -- Carey -- torn to shreds and fighting off Kramer's golden retriever dog.  The doors close.  Kramer approaches an OFFICER.
What's the latest, Lieutenant?
They'll hit our atmosphere in about three minutes, if they hold together.  They've lost their computer and are coming in at zero point five WORP on manual control, sir.
Ted shifts a stick shift on the steering column.
Kramer looks at the big screen. SFX:  SUBMARINE SIREN WAILS.
Down scope!
A submarine periscope drops.  Kramer looks for the shuttl
He'll never bring that thing in on manual, but I guess Striker's their only hope.
It's his ship now.  He's the top dog.

head_text.subj: PERISCOPE SHOT OF SHORE LINE FROM WWII FILM

text: The big man.  The numero uno honcho.
The head cheese.

head_text.subj: PERISCOPE SHOT OF THE ED SULLIVAN SHOW

text: Kramer steps away from the scope.  It drops down.  A man a barber chair is on the other end of the steel column an comes to rest on the floor.
Sir, we have radio contact.
Testa talks to the passengers.  Psychedelic lights flash.
(yelling) We're travelling at one half the speed of light.  There is nothing to worry about. However, you might experience some temporary metabolic changes.
Her beard grows.
A flurry of hands empties it in two seconds.
He has turned into a Hassidic Rabbi.
Ted is fighting to maintain control.
Striker, this is Rex Kramer on Alpha Beta. Do you read me?  Over.
Ted and Elaine give startled looks of recognition.
That's right, Ted.  Rex Kramer.  We've locked you on track beam.  You're going to have to kill those WORP engines in exactly thirty seconds.  Over.
Everyone tensely looks out the window into the night sky. McCROSKY There's nothing else we can do for those people out there now, except pray.
The entire room explodes in an up-beat Southern Baptists' rendition of "HE'S GOT THE WHOLE WORLD IN HIS HANDS".
Now, Striker!  Kill WORP!
Ted pushes his WORP lever forward but it comes off in his hand.
Ted, the lever!
(on radio) Kramer, the WORP control handle just came off in my hand.
Try another handle!
There are no more handles, only switches.
No buttons?!
(looking around madly) Just switches, lights, and knobs.

(looking at buttons and levers on his panel) I'd give my right arm to get just one of these buttons or levers up there right now. (on radio) Okay, Striker.  You're going to have to pull that lever panel off.
(to Elaine) Screw driver!
She hands him a vodka and orange juice.  Ted throws it on his face.  He reaches down and rips the panel off, exposi all sorts of wires.
Now find a piece of metal and stick it in there.
Ted looks around for a piece of metal.  Elaine pulls a bo pin from her hair.
Will this work, Ted?
Her long brown hair falls sexily.  She sweeps it back wit toss of her head.  Ted is overwhelmed by her.
Thanks. (on radio) I've got something that might work.
A bobby pin.
Kramer and Aids exchange a look which questions Ted's sexuality.
What the hell is a man doing with a... forget it. (on radio) It'll have to do, Striker.
Ted sticks the bobby pin into the wires.  Sparks fly.  Th ship starts slowing up. SFX:  THE ENGINE WHINE SUBSIDES.
It's working.
Kramer stands in front of the huge screen.  A small ship appears in the distance coming right at us.
(on radio) Okay, Striker.  We have you on visual. Just keep her level.
It careens towards the planet surface.
It starts bouncing wildly.
She's coming apart!
Passengers scream.
The anchorman screams. SUPER:  "EDITORIAL".
The anchorman screams. SUPER:  "EDITORIAL".  (In Russian looking print.)
The desk clerk screams.
Keep her nose up!  Don't fight her!
I'm trying but she's fighting me!
A boxing glove springs from the dash punching Ted in the face.
Ted, that's Alpha Beta!
We see the lights of a small colony on planet surface.  T Alpha Beta neon sign is visible.

Kramer sits in a large swivel chair -- like Captain Kirk' on the Enterprise bridge.  As he talks, he nonchalantly swivels so his back is to the huge window.  We see the Mayflower approaching on the screen.
(on radio) Now, Striker, there are a few things you have to keep in mind as you get close to the planet's atmosphere.
They watch in horror as the Mayflower comes shooting at them.
(on radio) First and foremost you have to make one very important decision.
Elaine looks out the window -- horrified.
Ted!  We're not stopping!!
Ted fights the controls.
Is this a landing you're sure you can make without endangering the lives of your passengers?
They run for cover.
The Mayflower comes right at the screen and crashes throu it.  Kramer still has his back to the screen and doesn't notice what has happened -- the room behind him has been totally demolished.
(on radio) Now, once you've made that decision you have to be very clear about your responsibility to those people on that ship.
The front window is broken.  Ted and Elaine are covered i debris.  Elaine's eyes grow wide with terror again.
Ted!

A group of scientists stand at a keyboard synthesizer.  O plays the series of notes from CLOSE ENCOUNTERS.  Suddenl the Mayflower appears over a hill.  They all jump for cov as it crashes through the synthesizer.
Ted and Elaine are covered in piano keys.
Their lives, their futures, their goals and aspirations are in your hands, Striker.
The Mayflower bounces across the surface.
Mary maneuvers down the aisle.  Passengers are screaming being tossed around.
(to one passenger) Seat backs up.  Thank you.
She looks up and sees feet dangling from the ceiling.  A has gone right through the ceiling up to his waist.
(looking up) Sir, you really must take your seat.
(on radio) We're all with you on this one, Striker. Now get ready to position landing gear, cut engines, and fire your retrorockets.
The Mayflower careens to a smoking, crunching, shattering stop.
Mary and Testa start directing panic-striken passengers t the exits.
(on radio) Timing's of the essence on a lame duck approach, Striker.  Don't fight her.  Hold her steady.  Nose up.
Ted and Elaine stand looking down on the wreckage.  In b. SIRENS WAIL, emergency lights flash across Ted and Elaine
You'll be all right!  Everyone's going to be okay!
Ted holds Elaine.
Don't fight her, Striker.  Hold her!  Hold her!  Stay with her, Striker!
Ted and Elaine kiss.
Now, hit your landing gear and cut those engines!
(on radio) Timing's everything, Striker!  Fire your retro-rockets!
Ted and Elaine walk off into the distance. SFX:  SIRENS FROM CRASH AREA IN DISTANCE.
(voice fading) Now give her full flap and keep that nose up.  Okay, now!
Ted, what's going to happen to us?
Ted stops and looks into the distant, dark sky.  A printe crawl begins:

FAR, FAR AWAY IN THE DEEPEST REGIONS OF OUR VAST SOLAR SYSTEM, A SMALL, BRAVE GROUP OF PIONEERS EMBARK ON A BOLD NEW ADVENTURE.  THEIR MISSION:  TO OPEN UP A NEW FRONTIER.  THEIR GOAL, TO BUILD A BRAVE NEW WORLD.
Ted and Elaine walk towards crawl and are approached by t strange CREATURES -- bald with a shock of hair sprouting from the top of their heads.
Hello, we'd like you to have this flower. We're with the Church of Mercurial Consciousness.  Would you like to make a donation?
